result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Domestic Abuse Crime [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER SERVING 2 YEARS.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with case 22CF3795 and 22CF481.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both.

Not to reside or be present where guns are present in any vehicle.
No contact with Ana D.O. for entire sentence unless agent consents to change.

supervisions.notes: Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court orders DV assessment imposed. 
Court sets restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones in court, in custody.  Attorney Erik I. Colque Aty in court for Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Chwaszczewski & Natalia Fajardo. State advise of victim notification. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of  4 YEARS, concurrent to case 22CF3795 and 22CF481, credit for 248 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Not to reside or be present where guns are present in any vehicle.
- Complete a domestic violence class.
- No contact with Ana D.O. for entire sentence unless agent consents to change.

- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court orders DV assessment imposed. 

*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER SERVING 2 YEARS.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, 
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones in court with attorney Erik I. Colque.  Defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez.
 Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Court REMANDS for sentencing. Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones in court with attorney Erik I. Colque.  Defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Remi Bashi.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Parties inform court that they are in a global resolution posture. Judge further authorizes transfer to Br 04 for global resolution. Case adjourned for a Status Conference to Br 04.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BE. 29
Defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones in court, appear by video with attorney Erik I. Colque, appear by video.  Defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Natalia Fajardo.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Invstigator G. Carrasco.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 059872,
Payable Number: 1016450,
Receipt Number: 22RP026243,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with Ana D-O
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Luis Angel Figueroa-Quinones in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
